text: First, let's block a number.
Find the number you want to block
in your recents or contacts
and click the info button.
Scroll down and click "Block this Caller."

Next, you'll be prompted
to verify the block.
Click "Block Contact" to finalize.

Now let's head over to
the blocked cellphone
and see what it looks like

when you try and contact the
person who has blocked you.
First, let's make a call.

Automated voice: Your
call has been forwarded
to an automated voice-messaging system.
Narrator: The blocked caller
will be sent straight to your voicemail.
And this would be their only indication
that they've been blocked, by the way.
The person can still leave a voicemail,

but it won't show up in
your regular messages.
Instead, you need to scroll down
to the bottom of the voicemail window
and click on the blocked messages tab.
Voicemail: Hey, I was just wondering
why your phone's not ringing.

Could you give me a call back
when you get this? Thanks.
Narrator: Now let's send a text message.
Delivered and read notifications
do not show up on the blocked phone,

and the message never
arrives at your phone.

The message just disappears
and will never be delivered.

Now let's try a FaceTime
from the blocked phone.
[iPhone ringing]
As you can see,

the FaceTime will just
keep ringing and ringing

until the blocked caller
decides to hang up.
[iPhone ringing]
